data.title: Australia's Origin Energy logs 12% sequential fall in first-quarter APLNG revenue
data.description:
Australia's Origin Energy on Friday posted a 12% sequential fall in revenue for the first quarter from its stake in the Australia Pacific LNG project, hurt by lower LNG volumes and prices.

The power producer reported revenue from the APLNG project — a joint venture with U.S. oil and gas major ConocoPhillips and China's state-owned Sinopec — of A$482 million ($313.20 million) for the three months ended September 30, compared with A$547 million in the June quarter.

Liquefied natural gas prices hit multi-week lows over the quarter as lackluster demand across Asia persisted, especially from major LNG consumer and Australia's largest trading partner, China, while production remained healthy alongside ample stockpiles.

Origin realised $10.08 per metric million British thermal units (mmBtu) in the quarter for its LNG product from the APLNG project in Queensland, compared with $10.26 per mmBtu in the June quarter.

The energy retailer's total production share from the project remained stable in the three months compared to the previous quarter while total sales slipped 1% sequentially to 44.4 petajoules.

($1 = 1.5389 Australian dollars)

data.title: Amazon Stock Jumps on Earnings Beat. AWS Is Doing Fine. — Barrons.com
data.description:
By Tae Kim

Amazon reported better-than-expected earnings results. Its shares were up sharply in after-hours trading.

For the September quarter, the company reported adjusted earnings per share of $1.95, compared to Wall Street's consensus estimate of $1.57, according to FactSet. The earnings included investment gains from AI start-up Anthropic. Revenue came in at $180.2 billion, which was ahead of analysts' expectations of $177.9 billion.

Revenue for Amazon's closely watched cloud unit, AWS, was $33 billion versus $32.5 billion analyst estimate.

Amazon said revenue for the current quarter would be between $206 billion to $213 billion, versus the $208.4 billion average analyst estimate.

"We continue to see strong demand in AI and core infrastructure, and we've been focused on accelerating capacity," Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said in a press release.

On the earnings conference call with analysts, Jassy said the company has doubled AWS capacity measured by power from 2022 and is on track to double capacity again by 2027.

Amazon shares, which were up about up 10% on the earnings release, rose more after Jassy's AWS capacity remarks. They were up as much as 14% during hte earnings call.

On Tuesday, UBS analyst Stephen Ju raised his price target for Amazon to $279 from $271 and reiterated a Buy rating on the stock.

"We continue to see the potential for upside across Amazon's business segments including e-commerce, cloud, advertising, and Kuiper / low earth orbit satellites," he wrote.

Ju said AWS's revenue could improve in the fourth quarter and the first half of next year as Amazon adds more data-center capacity. He said, though, that his checks on spending by AWS customers as the year ends point to a "less robust" picture than for Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud.

On Tuesday, Amazon said it is cutting 14,000 corporate jobs, citing the need to remove layers and reduce bureaucracy.

Amazon stock is up 2% so far this year as of Thursday's close, significantly underperforming the 22% rise for the Nasdaq Composite.

Write to Tae Kim at tae.kim@barrons.com

This content was created by Barron's, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. Barron's is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.

The mean expectation of sixteen analysts for the quarter was for earnings of $2.50 per share. Wall Street expected results to range from $2.45 to $2.56 per share.

  • Revenue rose 9.1% to $1.34 billion from a year ago; analysts expected $1.33 billion.

  • Resmed Inc's reported EPS for the quarter was $2.37​.

  • The company reported quarterly net income of $348.54 million.

  • Resmed Inc shares had fallen by 7.3% this quarter and gained 10.9% so far this year.

FORECAST CHANGES

  • The mean earnings estimate of analysts had risen by about 0.9% in the last three months.​

  • In the last 30 days, there have been no earnings estimate revisions by analysts covering the company.

RECOMMENDATIONS

  • The current average analyst rating on the shares is "buy" and the breakdown of recommendations is 13 "strong buy" or "buy," 7 "hold" and 1 "sell" or "strong sell." The average consensus recommendation for the advanced medical equipment & technology peer group is also "buy"

  • Wall Street's median 12-month price target for Resmed Inc is $300.00, about 15.9% above its last closing price of $252.26

data.title: ICF Names Operating Chief to Dual Finance-Operations Role
data.description:
By Kelly Cloonan

ICF appointed Chief Operating Officer James Morgan to the additional role of chief financial officer, effective March 1.

Morgan succeeds CFO Barry Broadus, who will retire on the same date, the solutions and technology provider said.

Morgan has been the company's COO since 2020. He previously held the company's CFO role from 2012 to 2020. His base salary will increase to $700,000 from $659,906, plus other compensation with his new role.

ICF also named Executive Vice President Anne Choate as president, effective at the start of next year. Choate has been at the company for 30 years and currently leads ICF's energy, environment and infrastructure and disaster recovery client markets. Her base salary will increase from $600,000 from $535,000, plus other compensation with her new role.

Broadus will remain a consultant to ICF after his retirement, ICF said. He joined the company in 2022.

Write to Kelly Cloonan at kelly.cloonan@wsj.com

data.title: Serve Robotics CFO Sells Shares to Meet Tax Obligations
data.description:
Reporter NameRead Brian
RelationshipChief Financial Officer, 10% Owner
TypeSell
Amount$16,916
SEC FilingForm 4

Brian Read, Chief Financial Officer and 10% owner of Serve Robotics, sold 1,270 shares of common stock on October 30, 2025, at a price of $13.32 per share, totaling $16,916. This sale was to satisfy tax withholding obligations related to vested RSUs. Following this transaction, Read directly owns 353,827 shares of Serve Robotics common stock.

SEC Filing: Serve Robotics Inc. /DE/ [ SERV ] - Form 4 - Oct. 30, 2025

data.title: Giant Mining Corp. Provides Update on Canada Postal Strike and Voting at the Company's 2025 Annual General Meeting
data.description:
(TheNewswire)

    VANCOUVER, BC — October 30, 2025– TheNewswire — Giant Mining Corp. (CSE:BFG | OTC:BFGFF | FWB:YW5 | CSE:BFG.WT.A |CSE:BFG.WT.B) (“Giant Mining” or the “Company”) advises that due to theongoing postal strike in Canada, we stronglyrecommend that shareholders vote online for the Company’s upcomingannual general meeting scheduled for Thursday, December 4, 2025, at9:00 a.m. PST, the proxy cut-off time being Tuesday, December 2, 2025,at 9:00 a.m. PST, by sending your proxy via email to Endeavor TrustCorporation at proxy@endeavortrust.com .

    Detailed voting instructions are available on the proxyform, which can be found on the Company’s website at https://giantminingcorp.com/and filed on the Company’s SEDAR+ corporate profile at www.sedarplus.ca.

    Registered holders will need to contact Endeavor TrustCorporation at proxy@endeavortrust.comand request a control number and password before votingtheir Giant Mining Corp. common shares online at www.eproxy.ca or bycompleting the proxy form and submitting their vote by fax at604-559-8908 or email at proxy@endeavortrust.com .

    Shareholders who hold Giant Mining Corp. common sharesin a brokerage account should contact their broker for details on howto submit their vote online.

    About Giant Mining Corp.

    Giant Mining is focused on identifying, acquiring, andadvancing late-stage copper and copper/silver/gold projects to meetthe growing global demand for critical metals. This demand is drivenby initiatives like the Green New Deal in the United States andsimilar climate-focused programs worldwide, which require substantialamounts of copper, silver, and gold for electric vehicles, renewableenergy infrastructure, and the modernization of clean and affordableenergy systems.

    The Company’s flagship asset is the Majuba HillCopper, Silver, and Gold District, located ~155miles (251 km) from Reno, Nevada. Majuba Hill issituated in a mining-friendly jurisdiction with supportive regulationsand has the potential to become one of the next major copper deposits,critical for meeting the increasing need for this red metal.

    Neither the Canadian SecuritiesExchange nor its Market Regulator (as that term is defined in thepolicies of the Canadian Securities Exchange) accepts responsibilityfor the adequacy or accuracy of this release.

    On Behalf of the Board of GiantMining Corp.

    “David Greenway”

    David C. Greenway

    President & CEO

    For further information, please contact:

    E: info@giantminingcorp.com

    P: 1 (236) 788-0643

    VISIT OUR WEBSITE FOR MORE DETAILS

    www.giantminingcorp.com

    LIKE AND FOLLOW

    Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn


    DOWNLOAD INVESTOR INFORMATION


    Click Here


    Forward-Looking Statements


    This news release contains certain
    forward‐looking information. Such information
    involves known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors that
    may cause actual results, performance or achievements to be materially
    different from those implied by statements herein, and therefore these
    statements should not be read as guarantees of future performance or
    results. All forward‐looking statements are
    based on the Company’s current beliefs as well as assumptions made
    by and information currently available to it as well as other factors.
    Readers are cautioned not to place undue reliance on these
    forward‐looking statements, which speak only as of
    the date of this press release. Due to risks and uncertainties,
    including the risks and uncertainties identified by the Company in its
    public securities filings, actual events may differ materially from
    current expectations. Company has utilized artificial intelligence
    (“AI”) tools and modeling in its exploration targeting, such
    technologies are emerging and unproven in mineral exploration. There
    can be no assurance that the use of AI will improve exploration
    outcomes, result in discoveries, or provide results consistent with
    management’s expectations. The Company disclaims any intention or
    obligation to update or revise any forward‐looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future
    events or otherwise.


    ###

    Copyright (c) 2025 TheNewswire - All rights reserved.

data.title: Hub Group Inc reports results for the quarter ended September 30 - Earnings Summary
data.description:
• Hub Group Inc reported quarterly adjusted earnings of 49 cents​​ per share for the quarter ended September 30, lower than the same quarter last year, when the company reported EPS of 52 cents. The mean expectation of sixteen analysts for the quarter was for earnings of 49 cents per share. Wall Street expected results to range from 46 cents to 51 cents per share.

  • Revenue fell 5.3% to $934.50 million from a year ago; analysts expected $926.11 million.

  • Hub Group Inc's reported EPS for the quarter was 47 cents​.

  • The company reported quarterly net income of $28.55 million.

  • Hub Group Inc shares had risen by 3.7% this quarter and lost 19.8% so far this year.

FORECAST CHANGES

  • The mean earnings estimate of analysts had fallen by about 5.8% in the last three months.​

  • In the last 30 days, ten analysts negatively revised earnings estimates

RECOMMENDATIONS

  • The current average analyst rating on the shares is "buy" and the breakdown of recommendations is 6 "strong buy" or "buy," 11 "hold" and no "sell" or "strong sell." The average consensus recommendation for the ground freight & logistics peer group is also "buy"

  • Wall Street's median 12-month price target for Hub Group Inc is $39.00, about 9.1% above its last closing price of $35.46

data.title: Star Gold Corp. SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Star Gold Corp., a pre-development stage company focused on the acquisition and exploration of precious metal deposit properties, particularly gold and silver in Nevada, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter. The report provides a detailed overview of the company's financial performance and operational activities, highlighting increased operating expenses and strategic developments in its exploration projects.

Financial Highlights

  • Total Operating Expenses: $114,650, reflecting an increase from the previous year's $87,309, primarily due to higher legal and professional fees and management and administrative expenses.
  • Loss from Operations: $(114,650), compared to $(87,309) in the prior year, indicating increased operational costs.
  • Net Loss: $(130,384), up from $(99,437) in the previous year, driven by increased operating expenses and interest expenses.
  • Basic and Diluted Loss Per Share: $Nil, consistent with the previous year, reflecting no change in the loss per share despite the increased net loss.

Business Highlights

  • Corporate Background: Star Gold Corp. is a pre-development stage company focused on the acquisition and exploration of precious metal deposit properties, particularly gold and silver, in Nevada. The company aims to advance these properties toward production.
  • Longstreet Property: The Longstreet Property, located in Nevada, comprises 142 mineral claims covering approximately 2,500 acres. The property is at an intermediate stage of exploration, with the company focusing on assembling a high-quality group of mid-stage mineral exploration prospects.
  • Exploration and Development Activities: The company is engaged in identifying specific drill targets and conducting subsurface sampling to confirm mineralization. The focus has shifted from exploratory drilling to pre-development activities, including environmental and anthropological studies for a Plan of Operations and mine construction permit.
  • Regulatory Compliance: Star Gold Corp. must comply with federal, state, and local regulations related to land ownership, mining rights, and environmental laws. The company operates under various permits for exploration, reclamation, and environmental considerations.
  • Future Operations: For the fiscal year ending April 30, 2026, the company plans to conduct hydrology drilling, geochemical analysis, and develop a Plan of Operations for the Longstreet Project. The goal is to prepare an Environmental Impact Statement and obtain necessary mine permits for an open pit/heap leach mine.
  • Competition: The company faces competition from other mineral resource exploration and development companies with greater financial and technical resources. This competition could impact Star Gold Corp.'s ability to finance exploration and develop its mineral properties.
  • Office and Facilities: The company maintains its administrative office in Coeur d’Alene, Idaho, and does not own any real property. Business operations are conducted through independent contractor agreements with consultants.
  • Liquidity and Capital Requirements: The company anticipates relying on sales of debt and equity securities to fund operations. Additional financing will be required to complete necessary steps for final permitting. The company may consider mergers, property sales, joint ventures, or farm-out arrangements to secure funding.
  • Going Concern: The company has incurred operating losses since inception and has limited financial resources. There is substantial doubt about its ability to continue as a going concern without additional financing or successful exploration outcomes.

SEC Filing: Star Gold Corp. [ SRGZ ] - 10-Q - Oct. 30, 2025

data.title: Origin Had No 1Q Investments Vs. A$183 Million in Prior Qtr
FRANKLIN ELECTRIC CO INC SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Franklin Electric Co Inc, a global leader in the manufacturing and distribution of water and fueling systems, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights significant financial growth and robust business performance across various segments, driven by strategic acquisitions, price realization, and increased volumes.

Financial Highlights

  • Net Sales: $581.7 million, a 9% increase compared to the third quarter of 2024, driven by higher volumes, price realization, and acquisitions.
  • Gross Profit: $208.7 million, representing a gross profit margin of 35.9%, slightly up from 35.7% in the same period of 2024.
  • Operating Income: $85.1 million, a 16% increase from the third quarter of 2024, attributed to higher sales and improved cost management.
  • Net Income: $17.2 million, significantly impacted by a $55.3 million pre-tax pension settlement charge in the third quarter of 2025.
  • Diluted EPS: $0.37, a decrease from $1.17 in the third quarter of 2024, primarily due to the pension settlement loss.

Business Highlights

Revenue Segments

  • Water Systems net sales increased by 11% in Q3 2025 and 7% in the first nine months of 2025, driven by acquisitions, favorable volumes, and price realization.
  • Energy Systems saw a 15% increase in Q3 2025 and 9% in the first nine months, primarily due to price realization and favorable volumes.
  • Distribution segment sales rose by 3% in Q3 2025 and 2% in the first nine months, attributed to higher volumes and price realization.

Geographical Performance

  • In the U.S. and Canada, Water Systems sales increased by 9% in Q3 2025, with significant growth in large dewatering equipment and water treatment products.
  • Outside the U.S. and Canada, Water Systems sales rose by 15% in Q3 2025, with notable growth in Europe, despite a negative impact from foreign exchange rates.
  • Energy Systems sales in the U.S. and Canada increased by 11% in Q3 2025, with strong performance across all product lines, particularly fuel pumping systems.
  • Internationally, Energy Systems sales grew by 26% in Q3 2025, led by the Asia Pacific region.

Sales Units

  • The Water Systems segment reported a 38% increase in sales of large dewatering equipment and a 9% increase in water treatment products in Q3 2025. Groundwater pumping equipment sales remained flat.

Future Outlook

  • The company anticipates ongoing challenges from tariffs and global trade policy changes, which could impact operations. However, it remains focused on leveraging acquisitions and managing costs to drive growth. The company expects its capital resources and liquidity position to be adequate to meet projected needs for the foreseeable future.

SEC Filing: FRANKLIN ELECTRIC CO INC [ FELE ] - 10-Q - Oct. 30, 2025

data.title: CIMPRESS plc SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
CIMPRESS plc, a global leader in mass customization, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter, showcasing robust financial and operational performance. The company, known for its diverse portfolio of brands including Vista, PrintBrothers, and The Print Group, has demonstrated significant growth across various segments and geographies, driven by strategic initiatives and operational efficiencies.

Financial Highlights

  • Total Revenue: $863.3 million, increased by 7% compared to the prior year, driven by growth in Vista and PrintBrothers segments.
  • Gross Profit: $402.8 million, reflecting efficiencies in advertising and operating expenses.
  • Operating Income: $49.0 million, an increase of $9.6 million due to incremental gross profit and cost efficiencies.
  • Net Income: $6.5 million, an increase of $18.9 million, influenced by higher operating income and unrealized hedging gains.
  • Diluted Net Income Per Share: $0.30, an increase of $0.80, reflecting improved profitability.

Business Highlights

  • Revenue Segments: The Vista segment reported revenue of $454.9 million, driven by strong performance in promotional products, apparel, and gifts (PPAG) and packaging and labels across all major markets. PrintBrothers and The Print Group segments also showed significant growth, with revenues of $184.7 million and $96.7 million, respectively, primarily due to new customer acquisitions and increased order volumes.
  • Geographical Performance: North America remains a key market, contributing $413.7 million to total revenue, with significant contributions from the Vista and National Pen segments. Europe also performed well, generating $413.6 million in revenue, with PrintBrothers and The Print Group being major contributors.
  • Sales Units: The increase in order volumes across the Vista and PrintBrothers segments indicates a strong demand for customized products, contributing to the overall revenue growth.
  • New Production Launches: Pixartprinting's U.S. facility, which went live in March 2025, is now fulfilling orders for other Cimpress businesses, expanding its offerings and launching its brand in North America.
  • Future Outlook: The company plans to continue leveraging its mass customization platform to drive efficiencies and competitive advantage. It remains focused on managing supply chain constraints and inflationary pressures while optimizing pricing and sourcing strategies to mitigate the impact of tariffs.

SEC Filing: CIMPRESS plc [ CMPR ] - 10-Q - Oct. 30, 2025
